FuncDef:
The pvc command creates a PVC with a specified VPI/VCI and displays the PVC view.
The undo pvc command deletes a PVC.
By default, no PVC is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a PVC name.
The value is created using the pvc command. The value of vpi/vci for each PVC must be unique on an ATM interface (including its sub-interfaces).
Notice: The PVC name cannot be valid VPI/VCI values. For example, it cannot be 1/20.
The value is a string of 1 to 16 case-insensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies a virtual path identifier (VPI) / virtual channel identifier (VCI).
The PVC identified by pvcBeg must have been created.
VPI: The value is an integer, and its range varies with the interface type.
UNI interface: The value ranges from 0 to 255.NNI interface: The value ranges from 0 to 4095.
VCI: The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 2 and 5 to 65535.
The VCI values 0 to 31 are reserved for special use.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
ATM is connection-oriented. ATM connections are logical connections, called VCs. A virtual channel connection (VCC) consists of multiple VPs, and a VP consists of multiple VCs. Each VC is identified by a VPI/VCI.
VPI: identifies a VP.VCI: identifies a VC.
A VPI/VCI is of local significance for a link between ATM devices and is translated on the ATM devices. When a VC connection is released, the VPI/VCI value for the connection is also reclaimed and can be used by another connection.
When you create a PVC, you can specify vpi/vci or pvc-name. If you specify pvc-name, you must also specify vpi/vci. If a PVC has a name, you can run the pvc pvc-name command to enter the PVC view.If you want to delete a PVC, you can specify pvc-name or vpi/vci in the undo pvc command.

Prerequisites
A sub-interface has been created on a serial interface whose link layer protocol is configured as ATM.
Configuration Impact
If the number of PVCs on an interface reaches the maximum number configured using the pvc max-number command, no more PVCs can be created.
Precautions
The value of vpi/vci for each PVC must be unique on an ATM interface (including its sub-interfaces).
The VCI values 3, 4 are reserved.
The VPI and VCI values cannot be both 0s.
The value of VPI/VCI cannot be 255/65535.
